boardgame.name: Archways (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the archways in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Archways is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Archways (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the archways in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Archways is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: The Last of Us: The Board Game
boardgame.description: The Last of Us: The Board Game is set in the world of Naughty Dog's critically acclaimed and best-selling video game series, The Last of Us.

boardgame.name: Elemental, Force of Nature
boardgame.description:
In Elemental, Force of Nature players take on the role of Elementals, powerful beings who are constantly battling and scheming to outdo each other by using and manipulating Natural Phenomena. Elementals have two main powers: crushing the Natural Phenomena of other Elementals with Phenomena of their own and manipulating the 6 primal elements that make up these Natural Phenomena to outwit their opponents.

As an Elemental, you will be dealt a hand of 7 Natural Phenomena cards. Going clockwise, Elementals take turns matching the elements on the cards while making sure to not leave too great of an opening for their opponents. The real strategy comes in gaining and using an Elemental's greatest resource: Elemental Tokens.

These token allow you to manipulate the elements that make up a Natural Phenomenon, or exchange Phenomena from your arsenal.

Your goal is to make sure no other Elemental can crush the Natural Phenomenon you play. Think of this as a battle for survival where the last one to play wins the round. A game is at least 3 rounds and the player who has won the most rounds wins and proves that they are the most powerful Elemental, a true force of nature!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Bundeswehr
boardgame.description:
Monopoly: Bundeswehr
NEW GAME FUN: For you we have linked the world-famous original Monopoly board game with the Bundeswehr life. Put together your own armed forces, buy offices, training areas and show your strategic skills. There are lots of little insiders hidden that will make you laugh. Your gaming fun gets a new fun level!
LOVE OF DETAIL: Discover the world of the Bundeswehr with detailed Eurofighter, folding spades, tanks and lots of explanations and facts! Get to know everyday life and the structures in a simple and humorous way. It makes civilians smile. Soldiers will encounter funny situations from their daily work during the game!

—description from the publisher(translated)

NEUER SPIELSPAß: Für dich haben wir das weltberühmte Original Monopoly Brettspiel mit dem Bundeswehr Leben verknüpft. Stell dir deine eigene Bundeswehr zusammen, kaufe Dienststellen, Übungsplätze und zeige deine strategischen Fähigkeiten. Es sind viele kleine Insider versteckt, die dich zum Lachen bringen werden. Dein Spielspaß bekommt ein neues Spaß Level!
LIEBE ZUM DETAIL: Entdecke die Bundeswehr-Welt mit detailgetreuen Eurofighter, Klappspaten, Panzer und vielen Erklärungen und Fakten! Lerne den Alltag und die Strukturen auf einfache und humorvolle Art kennen. Es bringt Zivilisten zum Schmunzeln. Soldaten und Soldatinnen werden während des Spiels immer wieder auf lustige Situationen aus ihrem Dienstalltag treffen!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: That's a You Problem
boardgame.description:
That's a You Problem is a casual card game for 2-8 players where you solve the problems in the world.

Collect resources to solve environmental and social problems, and get points by solving them, the first player to reach 15 points is the winner... but be careful, your friends could use special cards to stop you and mess your game.

At your turn, you get to draw one card for free and 2 actions, you could use your actions to play resources, trade cards with players, draw an extra card, discard problems, play special cards. Solving problems is always FREE!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Amnesia Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Nightmarish Case of Government Conspiracies in Sleepy Suburbia

In the tranquil suburb of Happyville, a Rift capable of turning nightmares into reality, has been causing enough death and chaos to galvanize the Gatekeepers to intervene. However, the women and men in gray are at a loss, following protocol rigidly yet playing into the hands of this Rift's demented plan. When the crew arrives, Happyville never seemed more peaceful yet was never as far from what it seems...

Amnesia Town plays like a classic “government cover-up in the suburbs” case. It draws from the Hollywood image of the Cold War era in the United States, when fear of communist spies was so great that anyone was a potential suspect and everyone kept up the appearance of being just swell.

On the surface, Happyville is overtly pretty and perfect, almost saccharine - a combination of the local disposition and the dulling effects of the heavy Mist cover in place, which turned people into dim-witted, forgetful, constantly-self-medicated Barbie dolls.

This case is built and narrated as such, to emphasizes the gap between the fake, flawless exterior of Happyville and that palpable and very ominous feeling that behind it all lies a deranged, horrible truth...

boardgame.name: The Furnace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Ill-Fated Case of Sweet Temptations and Stolen Dreams

A new drug has hit the streets of the city, a special drug for special people like you. It is said to make your sweetest dreams come true, but as it takes over the secret world of modern legends, new cases of missing persons crop up faster than you can solve them.

Some of the missing are soon found, wretched, empty, and lacking the will to live. As you set out to find what’s cooking in the dark wet lanes of the city, will you take a chance on your dreams and adopt this toothsome new fad?

The Furnace is a crime drama case which explores a new trend in the secret underworld of rifts in the city: a wish-fulfilling substance called “Candy”. This substance, which is readily available to the PCs, puts their personal desires and aspirations, as well as their private lives as rifts, in the limelight.

As the crew uncovers a Mythos-powered drug ring across the rift underworld, each PC will be able to play through this case as a detective, a victim of their desires, or both.

The case's trail of temptations is laid by a modern-day witch and the mystical motive behind the drug ring is only revealed at the end of the case.

boardgame.name: Podmiasto
The Undertrash
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Underground District of Warring Outcasts and Abandoned Oddities

Under the City there is a place to which the truly desperate turn, those who have been rejected by society or could not fit with the norms and demands of the ‘overland’. Some took too hard a hit in their personal, financial, or professional lives, pushed into the margins. Others decided to drop out of the rat race, finding it easier to opt out than rebuild.

Here, everything discarded finds a home: people, secrets, and trash. Here, there is value even in the most reviled things. Here, someone can shed their old life like the skin of a reptile.

And it is here, in the Undertrash, away from the prying eyes of the authorities and social norms, where misfits make their own rules...

This standalone PDF describes a new district in the City setting for the City of Mist RPG: the subterranean depths of The Undertrash. You can use this new district in your game to:

Explore the undesired. The Undertrash is where all unwanted things end up, be them people or items. If your crew is hunting for something no one wants, they will find themselves delving into the Undertrash.
Support the City above through the war below. The conflict between the factions of the Undertrash can have far reaching influence on a surprising number of conflicts above ground. The Cold Queen could be a vital ally of someone important to the crew, making her fight into their fight.
Lay low. The Undertrash is a great place to escape to. Once the crew find themselves in too deep or against too strong odds, they can find somewhere to hide (and maybe even some solace) in the tunnels below.
Search for ancient treasure. Some of the oldest Mythoi the City has ever known are hiding, or slumbering, in the depths of the Undertrash. Uncovering the true roots of the Old Quarter, or searching for a Relic of great importance, may lead you down to the Undertrash.
A last resort. When a player character loses a theme that was integral to their worldview, they might find themselves unable to recover. The Undertrash will welcome them, for as long they need - maybe forever...Chris Gunning

boardgame.name: Blades & Blasters: Running the Gauntlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Running the Gauntlet - A Sci-Fi/Fantasy Hybrid Adventure for 5E

The post-invasion world is a dangerous place. Aliens from the Xin Federation have conquered cities, kingdoms, possibly the entire world.

In Running the Gauntlet, players must successfully navigate the unfamiliar perils of this new world to gain freedom from their oppressors. Running the Gauntlet is a dungeon-centric adventure for a level 5 party from the world of Blades & Blasters. Outwit your cruel masters, beat the dungeon, reclaim your freedom, and liberate the city! Play it as a one-shot, as an adventure connected mini-campaign, or incorporate it into an existing story!

This adventure draws on material from the core B&B Rulebook, but the book is NOT REQUIRED for play; all relevant B&B material, including alien monsters, weapons, and technology, can be found within this adventure's pages.

What's Included?
With your purchase you'll get a full color and a printer-friendly version of the adventure PDF. Within its pages you'll find:

27 pages of adventure
9 pages of appendices which include stat blocks for all aliens, monsters, and NPCs, and rules for alien weapons and technologies

boardgame.name: SiegeStorm: Serafie
SiegeStorm: Seraphia
boardgame.description:
The radiant army of Seraphia is full of pompous Elves and boring do-gooders. They specialize in arts of protection, healing, and control - often outlasting their enemy. And if that fails, they can always hope for one of their overpowered angels to swoop in and slaughter the opponent or even grant you an additional turn.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Siege Storm: Seraphia Faction Publisher: Awaken Realms Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Blades & Blasters: Long Way Down
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long Way Down - A Sci-Fi/Fantasy/Horror Hybrid Adventure for 5E

As a remote village dons the trappings of its annual harvest festival, they are haunted by a brooding terror lurking beneath their feet.

Long Way Down is a spooky dungeon delve for a level 8 party from the world of Blades & Blasters. Master your emotions, discover the horrific secrets of the otherworldly Ghol 'ichaeus, and save the residents of Cullsfield before time runs out! Play it as a one-shot, as an adventure connected mini-campaign, or incorporate it into an existing story!

This adventure draws on material from the core B&B Rulebook, but the book is NOT REQUIRED for play; all relevant B&B material, including alien monsters, weapons, and technology, can be found within this adventure's pages.

What's Included?
With your purchase you'll get a full color and a printer-friendly version of the adventure PDF. Within its pages you'll find:

25 pages of adventure
14 pages of appendices which include stat blocks for all aliens, monsters, and NPCs; rules for alien weapons and technologies; and all relevant spells

boardgame.name: Egghead
boardgame.description:
Egghead is a deduction game where players can see everyone else's cards save for their own. Each turn players read off a question and answer it according to what they see on everyone's cards. Eventually this gives players enough information to deduce what is on their own cards and winning a point.

As their predecessor What's That on My Head? (from 1963), all 4 versions of Egghead are using the 6 letters A, B,C,D,E & G. Three versions use the headbands gimmick, but in one edition you have wooden banks to hold the colored letter cards. But unlike Code 777 (numbers 1-7) the colors are not involved in gameplay.

Similar to:

What's That on My Head?
Code 777
Figure It
Amnesia
Guess What I Am!
Coyote
Pow Wow
Am I a Banana?
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: What's That on My Head?

boardgame.name: The King's Armory: 7th Anniversary Edition
boardgame.description:
The King's Armory

...is a 100% pure co-op honoring the truest mechanisms of the online Tower Defense video game genre with a new Heroic feel.

At the start of each game you'll build your own map, choose your own Hero, and then battle ferociously against waves of oncoming monsters. Defeat every monster, on every wave, including their epic boss, and we all win. But should you let the Castle Gate fall, the enemies will use the powerful Armory Weapon against you. Who will win in this epic battle of good vs. evil?

You'll never go it alone, in the co-op, even if playing solo! Your small but might army of Heroes will hire new recruits to help you defend the castle, such as Foot Soldiers, Archers, Sorcerers, Clerics, and Psionicists.

What's New in the 7th Anniversary Edition?

The King's Armory now features 43 gorgeous new minis for Heroes and Hirable Characters alike, upgraded component quality including dice balance and tower strength, upgraded art, a fully rewritten manual, and more streamlined play via a new double-sided Wave Card for Monster Selection options.

Throw in a minor rebalancing of foes, equipment, and reinforcements, a few updates to the graphic design, and a 3x bigger box to hold all the new stuff, and the 7th Anniversary edition will scratch your every itch for hero-based tower defense with an even greater focus on the fun!

boardgame.name: Celestial Checkers
boardgame.description:
An ancient Chinese folk tale recounts that the Jade Emperor once held a feast to which he invited all the animals of the forest. Only twelve showed up. To reward his guests, the Jade Emperor announced that he would name a year of the Zodiac after each. The animals were all duly honored. But then the question of order arose. The Ox, the brawniest of all the animals but also the most dull-witted, insisted he should be first due to his tremendous strength. The Rat, puniest of all the animals but also the most cunning, argued he should be first due to his keen intelligence. The other animals, who possessed both strength and intelligence in varying degrees, soon joined the quarrel. Some sided with the Ox, saying that strength was more important than intelligence. Others sided with the Rat, saying intelligence was more important than strength. While still others wavered back and forth. So to settle the matter, the Rat proposed a contest.

This game uses the twelve animals of the Chinese Zodiac. Each animal possesses its own unique combination of strength and intelligence. During the first phase, strength is crucial; in the second phase, intelligence is valued.

The board starts off empty. The players alternately place their pieces on their sides of the board. Each piece must be placed on the unoccupied yellow spaces within their first three rows. The direction a piece is facing indicates which player it belongs to. After each player has placed all their twelve pieces, the game can begin. North, for having gone second during the set-up stage, gets to move first.

An animal can not capture an animal stronger than itself. The animals are ranked in strength, from strongest to weakest: 12. Ox, 11. Tiger, 10. Dragon, 9. Horse, 8. Dog, 7. Goat, 6. Pig, 5. Snake, 4. Rooster, 3. Monkey, 2. Hare, 1. Rat.

When an animal reaches the far rank, it is removed to the side and scored according to its intelligence. The animals are ranked in intelligence, from smartest to dumbest: 12. Rat, 11. Hare, 10 Monkey, 9. Rooster, 8. Snake, 7. Pig, 6. Goat, 5. Dog, 4. Horse, 3. Dragon, 2. Tiger, 1. Ox. As can be seen, an animal's intelligence is in inverse proportion to its strength. In other words, the weaker the animal the more valuable it is and vice-versa.

Other than this, normal Checkers rules apply. Pieces can only move diagonally forward, either by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible.

When one player is unable to make a move, by either having no more pieces left on the Checkerboard, or by having all his pieces blocked from movement, the game ends and the player with the higher score wins.

Incidentally, through prudent and skillful play the Rat was able to easily defeat the brute efforts of the Ox. On the Chinese Calendar, the Year of the Rat is first, and Year of the Ox second to this very day.

boardgame.name: Seeds of Plenty
boardgame.description:
Seeds of Plenty is a card game developed by Ko-Kee Games LLC for 2-5 players aged 8 and older 104 cards. Though the game was originally designed to be played within a family environment with very young players to adult ages it can be equally engaging for adults or youth to play the game by themselves.

The objective of the game is to be the first player to place vegetable plants in planter bins and fend off potential attackers that would uproot these vegetables. The first player to last one entire round with three planter bins still containing vegetables is the winner.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Armada: Two Player Starter Set
Kings of War: Armada
boardgame.description:
The Armada Two Player Starter Set is the perfect place to start your journey onto the seas of Pannithor in the Kings Of War universe.

Everything you need for two-players to start their own fleet of courageous Basileans or marauding orcs, along with a rulebook, tokens, ship cards and a paper gaming mat.

Players control 6 to 9 ships in 10 different scenarios.
Rules cover speed, fire, boarding action, weather, wind, terrain...

boardgame.name: Dirty F***ing Freaks
Dirty Fucking Freaks
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

A live-action roleplaying game about circus freaks, fighting and f**king.

From the introduction:

When I lived in San Francisco, I played a live-action roleplaying game. It was often exciting, sometimes boring and always frustrating.

Dirty Fucking Freaks is provoked by that game. Although I won’t name the system, there were parts I loved and parts I hated.

boardgame.name: Cena en París
Dinner in Paris
boardgame.description:
The restaurant industry in Paris is buzzing after the inauguration of a new pedestrian square in a very popular district for Parisians and tourists from all around the globe. It is a golden opportunity for you, restaurant owners, to open one of the addresses that will contribute to the culinary diversity and the reputation of the French capital. However, there isn’t space for everyone and your opponents could throw a wrench in your gears!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 UK Games Expo Best New Boardgame (Euro-Style) Nominee
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Dinner in Paris: Battle of the Chefs
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 57: Paris, Dinner In Paris, Quetzal - Top 5 Games of 2020

in excellent condition printed out solo variant and its in box as well

boardgame.name: Disciples the Game
boardgame.description:
Start a cult! Perform ridiculous rituals, collect disciples and forget your morals in this fun global strategy tabletop game.

Disciples is an easy-to-learn tabletop game, where you are a cult leader who collects disciples and sets up tents and temples around the world. The first player to build three temples wins.

You start by using your intuition to pick the 2 cards that decide your cult's name and rules. For example "Angels of the Gold Hive" or " Infinite Crown of Serpents". There are 144 possible combinations of cults. On each turn you roll, move across the map, perform your peculiar ritual, collect new disciples, tempt fate with the Cards of Consequence and built your tents and temples in various cities around the world.

There will be lots of laughs, surprises and turns of fortune. Luck meets strategy. You may get arrested or sued for your shady behavior. If you think you're winning, you probably won't. The game takes about 30 - 60 min.

This game is rated for ages 17+. Cult leaders are typically inappropriate. Fun for gamers and civilians alike.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: WWF Raw
boardgame.description: WWF Raw is coming to your living room! Square off with more than 45 of the WWF's toughest superstars including The Rock, Stone Cold Steve Austin, The Undertaker and Triple H. Or grab a tag-team partner and compete with up to 4 wrestlers in the ring at once. Features highly detailed graphics and authentic, TV-style presentation complete with superstar ring entrances and theme music. Imported.

boardgame.name: The Witching Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Witching Well provides a write-up of a local curiosity that can be dropped into any village gracing a traditional tabletop roleplaying game, providing history, rumours and plot hooks for the local well where a reputed witch met a grisly end.

boardgame.name: The Cask & Bottle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cask & Bottle is a simple, digest-sized two page spread containing details of a sample tavern that can be dropped into most traditional fantasy games, the spread contains details on locals, food & drink and rumours.

boardgame.name: Prince's Arms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Prince's Arms is a simple, digest-sized spread containing details of a sample tavern that can be dropped into most traditional fantasy games, however this tavern hides a sinister secret behind its doors.

boardgame.name: Storm and Sail
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Waves crash onto the deck, spraying saltwater into the eyes of hardened sailors, their voices drowned out by the thundering roars of cannons, belching fire and death!

This is the world of Storm & Sail, a world of magic and wonder, but also greed and terror, where Four Great Nations carve up the riches of the New World between them. But there are opportunities for the clever and the fortunate, in this time of uncertainty many strike out on their own, charting a course for plunder and adventure on the High Seas.

Some Fate Dice and this book are all you need to create astounding stories of daring do and swashbuckling adventure, so grab your treasure map and set sail into the fantastic world of Storm & Sail!

Storm and Sail is based on the Fate Accelerated rules system published by Evil Hat Productions, and contains all you need to create exciting adventures on the high seas.

Within this book you will find:

• Rules for running a pirate game with a crew and a ship, including naval battles and journeys.

• A Scaling system where your reputation does truly precede you.

• An elemental-based magic system for high fantasy adventures on the high seas.

• A new world constantly ravaged by four major countries, and yet still with its own secrets.

• Rules for building interesting heroes (and villans) in a time of swashbuckling adventure.

No additional rulebooks are required to use this product.

boardgame.name: World War III: Team Yankee – British Starter Force: Challenger Armoured Squadron
boardgame.description:
With its usual professionalism, the British Army had prepared for war.
Now, as the Soviet Army flooded across the border into West Germany, it was ready and waiting.
Fox, Scorpion and Scimitar recon vehicles skirmished with the Soviet forward detachments as the Challenger and Chieftain armoured regiments waited. The infantry held the towns and woods, forcing the enemy into killing zones, new Warrior infantry fighting vehicles in fire support. If anything broke through, the airmobile troops in their Lynx helicopters would hold them. The British Army is ready.

Includes:

Five Challenger Tanks
Two Chieftain Tanks
Two Warrior with Milan Anti-tank Vehicles
Two Scimitar or Scorpion Light Tanks
Four Fox Armoured Cards,
Two, MLRS Rocket Launchers
Two plastic Lynx helicopters
Eight rare-earth magnets
Four decal sheets
One Complete A5 Rulebook,
One British "Start Here Booklet"
Eleven Unit cards
One set of Death Or Glory Tokens
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World War III – Team Yankee 2 (Battlefront)

listing.notes:
1 WWIII: Team Yankee British Starter Force box set contains:
5x Challenger Tanks 2x Chieftain Tanks 2x Warrior (Milan) Anti-Tank Vehicles 2x Scimitar Or Scorpion Light Tanks 4x Fox Armoured Cars 2x MLRS Rocket Launchers 2x Lynx Helicopters Rules And Unit Cards
With its usual professionalism, the British Army had prepared for war. Now, as the Soviet Army flooded across the border into West Germany, it was ready and waiting. Fox, Scorpion and Scimitar recon vehicles skirmished with the Soviet forward detachments as the Challenger and Chieftain armoured regiments waited. The infantry held the towns and woods, forcing the enemy into killing zones, new Warrior infantry fighting vehicles in fire support. If anything broke through, the airmobile troops in their Lynx helicopters would hold them. The British Army is ready.

boardgame.name: Betcha Can't!
boardgame.description:
Could ya? Would ya?

Betcha Can't!

The Game of One-Upping

Can you name more flavors of ice cream than your friends? How about the most dance moves? Put your knowledge to the test with Betcha Can't! In this game of bets and brags, players bet on how many things they THINK they know. From dog breeds to smoothie flavors, place bets on how many you can name in the given amount of time. But beware - if you have the highest bet, you may be told "Betch Can't!" Prove yourself and name the number you bet to win the card. Fail the challenge, and you'll end up in Time Out - but you can try to break out by one-upping the winner of a round! The first player to collect five cards wins and is named the Better Bettor!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sumer Prime Convention Games
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a journey through frontier towns and untamed wilderness, give settlers swords and magic, sprinkle in harsh gods, religious zealots, and disbelievers, and you have Sumer Prime.

This book describes the campaign setting of Sumer Prime and includes five adventures for the fifth edition of the venerated role-playing game. Each adventure has been run multiple times at conventions and online.

• The Harvester (4th level) - Mysterious crimes plague the quiet villages down the coast from the tinker gnome city of Carnaticus.

• Exiled in Sumer Prime (6th level) - Escape evil gods that eat the souls of mortals, or help others at your own peril.

• Don't Drink the Water (8th level) - Follow the polluted Eugris river and face what lies at its source.

• Redefine (10th level) - Excavations at a temple site for an extinct race of giants have uncovered a chamber at the bottom of a vast cenote.

• The Redemption of Glasya (13th level) - Find the devil Glasya in the nation of Tangabar, a place rife with political and religious tension.

boardgame.name: Epic Seven Arise
boardgame.description:
Epic Seven Arise is the tabletop adaptation of the popular mobile game that pictures the heroes to save the 7th world from destruction. Official licensed by Smilegate Megaport.

Each player will enter the role of the heirs, beings created by the Goddess of Life, Diche, to protect the world of Orbis from the Archdemon and the Acolytes.

Each hero comes with a skill deck representing their unique set of skills to the table. You need to use your skills well if you intend to defeat the Archdemon.

During play, heroes must manage their actions and coordinate with the team, moving to the locations under the most threat and doing battle with enemies. Finding time to recover and purchase items between engagements as they prepare to defeat the monsters and enemies.

The game has multiple chapters, and each of them has a similar structure of main plot and side quests. If any hero dies during the round, it will have penalty but they can revive in the next round. As long as one of you is still alive, you still have a chance to win and get the highest score to be the ultimate winner in the team.

The chapters are all standalone and not contingent on being played in a certain order or with the same players.

The boardgame significantly broadens the original game’s universe and emphasises the depth of plot, yet its main focus will be on interactions driven by game stories and decision-making.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: D4 Dungeon: An OSR Dungeon Crawl RPG
boardgame.description:
D4 Dungeon is a light dungeon crawl and a love-letter to old-school RPGs. It includes all the maps you’ll need to play, four character cards for the greedy Tomb Robbers under your control, a Doom Clock to mark the hour of your ultimate demise, and the rules in a printer-friendly PDF.

The pyramid of Krug lies in the deep mists of the Valley of Bones, drifting in and out of reality as the tides of magic ebb and rise. Four determined tomb robbers have climbed the pyramid’s many black steps to reach the ancient tomb’s pinnacle, and the great door of bone.

Beyond the grim door’s threshold lie the many mysteries and horrors of the pyramid. Those who overcome them may discover great treasures, or a horrible end. Beware, for the pyramid’s power will work for and against you.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Battleship: zAPPed Edition
boardgame.description:
Each ship has its own super weapons!


Battleship
Aircraft Carrier
Destroyer


Battle aliens and protect the Earth!

Embark on epic missions around the globe ...

Hunt down alien targets ...

Destroy the enemy!

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Ziggurat: The Secret of Four Epigraphs
boardgame.description:
With smart actions, rewrite the Ziggurat wall epigraphs according to your goal and discover the secret of 4 ziggurat epigraphs sooner than other players by creating the desired patterns. To win, you need a variety of strategies and precise memory.
In Ziggurat: The Secret of Four Epigraphs, players use their hands to change the cards on the ground to make different patterns to complete their goals. Each player has unique goals but make other players' goals will give you diamonds. They help you to win sooner.
There is 52 epigraph cards whit different backs. also 13 goal cards and 9 diamond tokens.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kotakote
boardgame.description:
A GAME OF OBSERVATION AND SPEED
OBJECT: use your powers of observation and dexterity to replicate pictures as fast as possible.
All players receive the same 4 Kotakote cards, showing different-coloured geometric shapes on one side and half-finished pictures on the other. A “challenge” card is turned over in the middle of the table. The players must all try and replicate the picture shown on the challenge card by lining up 2 of their Kotakote cards correctly. Remember that only the cards required to complete the challenge can be placed on the table; players must keep hold of the others! The quickest player wins the “challenge” card, which they will need to keep hold of until the end of the game. The first player to win 5 “challenge” cards wins the game.

+++ Two difficulty levels available!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sweet Monster
boardgame.description:
A GAME OF MEMORY AND DEDUCTION
OBJECT: feed the little monsters by remembering where their favourite sweets are.
In this game, 12 double-sided tiles (with a monster on 1 side, and a sweet or rotten fish on the other) are placed in the middle of the table with monster sides facing up. When it is their turn, each player throws the 2 dice to get one monster and one sweet. Then they must turn the tile over that shows that combination. If they pick the right one, they win a token. Any tiles that are turned over are left with the new side facing up. Careful: if a player turns a tile over to find a rotten fish, they will need to give one of their tokens back! The game ends when a player wins their 5th token.

+++ A good memory and powers of deduction are a must if you’re going to find the right tiles!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Tric Trac Best Children's Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Animomix
boardgame.description:
A MATCHING GAME
OBJECT: are you ready to make some wacky animals by matching up heads, bodies and legs?
Each Animomix has 3 parts: their head, their body, and their legs. Careful you don’t get muddled up – the heads come in 2 different sizes, and so do the legs! At the start of the game, each player is dealt 4 cards. When it is their turn, each player asks another player for a head, a body, or a set of legs so that they can try and make a brand-new Animomix… but don’t forget that all three parts of the Animomix have to join up properly for it to count! The first player to make 4 Animomixes wins the game.

+++ Players will have to look carefully at their cards to match up the 3 parts of their Animomix properly!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Twist Up
boardgame.description:
A TEAM LANGUAGE GAME
OBJECT: good communication and listening skills are a must to beat the other teams and successfully replicate the challenge card.
In each team, one player is the speaker and one is the doer. Each doer takes a set of 9 “colour” cards and 9 see-through “animal” cards. The speakers each draw a “challenge” card, which they keep hidden. Then each speaker has to explain to their doer – just using words – how to place the “colour” and “animal” cards to replicate the picture shown on the “challenge” card. Both teams play at the same time, and the quickest to complete the challenge wins the card. The first team to win 5 challenges wins the game!

+++ Good communication is the key to success!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Djeco GAME - Twist Up Publisher: Djeco Language(s): English German Dutch

boardgame.name: Cheese Rescue
boardgame.description:
A STRATEGY GAME
OBJECT: to have as many pieces of your cheese left on the table as possible at the end of the game.
Each player is given 6 cheese cards and a selection of cat, mouse, and dog cards. Players take it in turns to place a card on the table, next to a card that has already been played. Once all the cards have been used up, it’s time to see who’s won: dogs scare cats, cats eat mice, and mice eat cheese, so any scared “cat” cards are removed from the table first, then “mice” cards, then “cheese”. The players take back any of their “cheese” cards that are left on the table, and add up their points. The player with the most wins.

+++ Nothing is certain in this game – everything only becomes clear right at the very end, so it’s all about strategy!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tapikekoi
boardgame.description:
MEMORY GAME
OBJECT: test your opponents’ memories by finding the things that have been stolen from around the house while the family is asleep.
Players take it in turns to be the family, while all the other players pretend they are thieves. Objects are placed on the boards that represent the family’s living room, kitchen, bedroom and garden. While the “family” player is asleep, the thieves steal things. When the “family” player wakes up, they have to use their memory to try and identify all the missing objects. If they miss one, the thief keeps it! New objects are added for each round. Who will collect the most counters?

+++ Each object can be put back in its usual place to help make it easier for players to remember them.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bluff Pirate
boardgame.description:
A BLUFFING GAME
OBJECT: become a pirate and be the first to find the treasure on the secret island by bluffing your way forward.
All aboard! A race has just begun to be the first to find the treasure hidden on one of the secret islands. To move your “ship” piece forward, you’ll need to play a set of identical cards. You can bluff and hide bits of the set you put down, but be careful your enemies don’t catch you out – that might give them the upper hand! Are you ready for an adventure?

+++ An introduction to bluffing!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Djeco GAME - Bluff Pirate Publisher: Djeco Language(s): English German Dutch

boardgame.name: Little Family
boardgame.description:
A GAME OF PAIRS
OBJECT: the animals are looking for their friends – can you help find them?
The “animal” cards are shuffled, and each player is dealt 4 cards. They place these cards in front of them so that everyone else can see them. The rest of the cards make up the draw deck. When it is their turn, each player draws a card and puts it in front of them. Then they look at all the cards on the table (their cards first, then the other players’ cards) and try to make a pair: either by using their own cards, or one of their own cards and one from another player. The game ends when all the pairs have been found, and the player who found the most wins.

+++ A game of pairs specially designed for little ones!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Little Mime
boardgame.description:
A GAME OF IMITATION AND COOPERATION
OBJECT: help the animals find their way home by pretending you’re their mummy.
4 “animal” cards are placed face-up in the middle of the table. These animals are lost! To help them find their way home, players must pretend to be their mummies. The first player starts by secretly choosing an animal from the table, and imitating the sounds they make, the way they move, or both. The other players have to work together to try and figure out what animal they are pretending to be. If they get it right, the animal can go home. Another player chooses a different animal to imitate, and so on until all 4 animals have found their way home!

+++ A introduction to imitation games for little ones to play together.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Little Puzzle
boardgame.description:
A PUZZLE AND COLOUR MATCHING GAME
OBJECT: for a successful fishing trip, you need to catch some whole fish! Who can catch 4 the fastest?
At the start of the game, all 24 half-fish are placed face-up in the middle of the table. Players all play at the same time, and must try to put 4 whole fish together as quickly as they can to win the game. Careful – for the fish to count, you need to find 2 matching halves with the same coloured spot!

+++ An introduction to observation games for toddlers.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chewer of Fingers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chewer of Fingers is a grim, old-school introductory adventure intended for The Midderlands setting. The adventure is written for Swords & Wizardry (Free pdf here) and therefore can be used in all retro-clones and old school role-playing games with little or no work. The book contains swear words and mature themes.

What’s Inside?
The encounters in the adventure take place in and around the small hamlet of Fetterstone—a depressing place on the edge of a stinking marsh near the border between the Western Midderlands and Staffershire.

The PCs are heading to Fetterstone because there is a 20 gold quid reward for the capture of an escaped criminal called ‘The Finger Chewer’. He absconded from Middlemoor Gaol five days ago and is believed to be hiding out in the surrounding oft-foggy marsh. The marsh is notoriously dangerous and even the lure of 20 gold quids isn’t enough to entice the locals into its fetid clutches.

The PDF version is an A5, 26-page bookmarked PDF.
The adventure features 4 encounter areas: Old Lady Harris’ Farm, The Village of Fetterstone and the Gloombug Tavern, Middlemoor Gaol, and The Marsh.
Four pregenerated adventurers are provided: Solomon Pilkington (Level 2 Human Cleric of Gael), Dergal Pock (Level 2 Wart Goblin Fighter), Norris Hitchcock (Level 2 Half-elf magic-User), and Elspeth Fallows (Level 2 Human Thief).
7 beautiful hand-drawn and scanned maps. These are also provided as separate unlabelled VTT versions with the PDF download.
The adventure is littered with extra details (game-juice) and adventure hooks that make this suitable for additional future adventures. Any Game Master could take the information contained and use it for their own campaigns.

boardgame.name: Little Match
boardgame.description:
A SHAPE AND COLOUR MATCHING GAME
OBJECT: to join the line, the animals must be the same colour or shape as the one before them. Help them get themselves in order!
The cards are shuffled, and each player is dealt 4 cards to hold. A card from the pack is turned over and put in the middle of When it is their turn, each player has to try and place a card the middle of the table – but the card either has to be the same as the one before, or show the same animal. If they can’t play they pick one up and the game moves to the next player. The player to have put all their cards in the middle of the table wins

+++ A quick and easy introduction to discarding games.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crypt of Veritas (2E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A cabal of foolish cultists have resurrected the sorcerer-lich, Veritas the Deathless. Undead horrors once again spew from her family crypts to terrorize the land, as she grows in power and schemes revenge.

You, bold hero, have vowed to dispatch Veritas, and to destroy her spellbook to prevent any chance of the evil’s return.

Pocket Dungeon: 2nd Edition is a series of solitaire adventure games, playable in 45-60 minutes, recommended for ages 12 and up. The new edition features a dramatic overhaul of the rules, creating a more balanced experience with even more options for the player to approach each challenge.

In addition to this document, you need 2 dice, a pen or pencil, and either a print-out of the Character Sheet (page 6) or a blank sheet of paper.

boardgame.name: Guzzle
boardgame.description:
GAME OF TACTICS
OBJECT: a frantic race to put together a perfect octopus.
Who will be the fastest to build their octopus? Each octopus will of course have to have 1 head and 8 tentacles, all of which must be properly connected to its head with the puzzle pieces. A multitude of possibilities, but only one winner! Be careful not to get your tentacles in a twist in the rush! Fancy making the game harder? Before you begin, choose a larger number of required pieces to fit into your octopus. Fastest player wins!

+++ A very simple assembly system for a task that is not as easy as it seems!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: Title: Guzzle Publisher: Djeco Language(s): English German Dutch

boardgame.name: Path to Newmarket
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The villagers of Newmarket have prospered from the new trade route passing through town. But a disgruntled former neighbor is about to get his revenge by turning the possessions they discarded when they got rich into animated objects and setting them against their former owners. Can your party save Newmarket from their old furniture and knick-knacks come back to bedevil them?

Exiles of Newmarket includes a new creature — swarm of animated objects — and several new non-magical items. is compatible with Pathfinder 2E, but it includes notes for running it with Pathfinder 1E. It is published under the Open Game License and it doesn't specify a setting, so that you can integrate it into your own campaign world.

boardgame.name: Non-Combat Random Encounters for Any Terrain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Travels can be long and arduous, but should by no means ever be boring for you or your players. The core rules present a variety of options to make travel more interesting through combat or non-combat encounters. In this document you’ll find some quick tables to tickle your imagination. Some of the things you roll up might turn into small side-quests, or even form the basis of a dungeon, while others are designed to be quick distractions that promote role-playing and immersion in a world designed to feel as a living, breathing thing. They are designed with the On the Shoulders of Heroes campaign setting in mind – but many of these encounters will fit into any traditional fantasy setting with iron age technology (and for any system).

boardgame.name: The Harvest Feast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the far north, a town is preparing for its annual harvest festival and the party is just in time to participate! But the festival is not all fun and games, the townsfolk will need their help with various chores and problems: a potion delivery, a pick pocket, a near drowning and a rowdy group of poachers. At the end of an exciting day they will have the chance to explore an ancient gravesite. This adventure is designed to introduce players to the game and their characters to each other.

This story can take place in any forest, but is designed to take place in the north of Kesma in Bellög.

Includes: a 7 page adventure with custom artwork, several mini-games designed to learn players about skills and abilities, a mini-dungeon, 1 new weapon and a new magic item

boardgame.name: Monsters & Magic: Monsters, Treasures and Adventures for 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reader Beware!

Whether you are a game master looking for new challenges to throw at your players, or a player looking for an exciting new character or familiar, this supplement has something you need. Within these pages you’ll find:

Almost 100 detailed entries of monsters inspired by European legends
Hooks and encounters that challenge novice and veteran heroes
New terrain features and obstacles
9 ready-made mini-adventures
A dozen new player races and character options


- A vault full of new magic items, ranging from trinkets to artifacts

boardgame.name: Gally & Grumble: Terrific Travels - Over 150 Roleplaying Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you looking for a way to make the journey as interesting as the destination? This full-color booklet contains travel rules for various common terrain types, rules to generate weather in various seasons, many recurring, seasonal and one-shot random encounters, and unique places to rest. Terrific Travel encounters are for groups of all ages, compatible with every fantasy RPG system, rules light and have a focus on storytelling over combat.

The G&G Guides are designed to help GMs make their world feel like a living thing and to assist them in the preparation and generation of adventures. A must have for every GM who loves a good travel story and who believes that the journey should be just as interesting as the destination.

The encounters in Terrific Travels are designed with your game in mind. Whether they are serious, silly, sad or funny, they will give your players opportunities to learn something about your world and to emerge themselves in the journey or the adventure. For your convenience, the encounters in Terrific Travels can be stand-alone experiences or used to enhance existing adventures. They can even be combined with existing encounter tables to create deeper, more interesting encounters!

With Terrific Travels you will visit the forest, swamp, grassland, mountain, underground and wasteland.

boardgame.name: Kaiju Kaos: Sinister Scarecrows – Named Characters
boardgame.description:
Kaiju Kaos – Sinister Scarecrows Stat Cards, Set 01

30 Named Characters including:

AHAB
BONESYLVANIA JACK
BONESYLVANIA PATCH
BRAUM
BUNYAN
CAPT. BIX MAX
CAPT. HALFMOON

WORZEL

16 Unnamed Characters including:

Assault Rifle Sharpshooter
Assault Rifle Trooper
Hatchet Specialist
Hatchet Trooper

Machete Trooper

Pitchfork Trooper
Scythe Specialist
Scythe Trooper

Speargun Trooper
Brawler
Melee Combat Trooper
Fast-Moving Skeleton
Slow-Moving Skeleton

2 new Specialized Burst Weapons including:

GAUNTFIELD’S Enchanted Bag of Bones
HALLOWEEN JACK’S Lantern Bomb

boardgame.name: Sakura Arms: Yurina Box
boardgame.description:
Choose two goddesses and combine their powers to form your own unique deck. Challenge your opponent to a fast, tactical, elegant duel beneath the sakura.

Sakura Arms is a stylish dueling card game from Japan that combines gorgeous art, deep tactics, and huge variety to minimalist duels. Setup is quick, play is simple, and the system of combining patron goddesses to build your deck provides unlimited variety.

Level 99 Games has teamed up with Bakafire Party to bring an all new production of the legendary Sakura Arms to English. The new edition features an enhanced rulebook and tutorials, quick start setups for each goddess, and improved production quality.

Includes 6 Goddesses and everything you need to play:

Yurina
Shinra
Oboro
Tokoyo
Himika
Yukihi


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Food Chain Island: Tough Skies
Isla Animal: Cielos Peligrosos
Die Schmatzinsel: Raue Lüfte
boardgame.description:
The skies are filled with beautiful, yet tough animals. Watch out as they will make your arrangements efforts even harder!

A three card expansion that will make your games just a little more challenging. At the beginning of the game, shuffle and place one card face-up into the play area. Do not use the others. During the game, you must activate, resolve and discard the air animal. The air animal must be resolved before the end of the game. For an additional challenge, use 2 or all 3 air animals.

boardgame.name: Food Chain Island: Friendly Waters
Isla Animal: Amigos del Mar
Die Schmatzinsel: Heimische Gewässer
boardgame.description:
The waters (and the animals within) are your friends. They'll help you arrange the land animals so they can eat each other. Anything to keep them out of the sea!

A 3 card expansion of additional sea animals to help you along the way. You can shuffle these in with the sea animals in the base game, then draw 2 for a normal difficulty, and draw less for an additional challenge.

boardgame.name: Face Factor
boardgame.description:
Face Factor is a party game where players act out different scenarios using only their head and facial expressions. Players then guess which scenario is being acted out. Face Factor is for ages 17+ and may include funny suggestive content. Face Factor game was created and written by Liza Salta in 2020.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Save Patient Zero
boardgame.description:
A new pathology has just appeared! Patient Zero has been identified, and it's up to you to find the antidote as soon as possible to save the patient and humanity!

Save Patient Zero pits two labs against each other. Each lab employs one or two scientists (i.e., players), while another player plays a lab computer named Savvy. The labs compete to identify an antidote of three molecules, with the labs typically sharing no information with one another; whichever lab finds the antidote first wins.

The general idea of the game is to use lab tools in the best sequence possible to identify the three molecules out of 25 that make up the antidote. (These 25 molecules are arranged in a 5x5 grid on each lab's worksheet.) At the start of the game, Savvy looks at the top three molecule cards in that deck, then sets them aside. These are the molecules the labs must identify. On a turn, each lab submits a tool card to Savvy to show what they want to do in the round, and whichever lab submits first takes its action first in that round. Actions include:


Samply: Draw three sample cards from your lab's deck, and give them to Savvy. Each sample card depicts five molecules, and Savvy will identify which of them show at least one molecule used in the antidote.
Mikroskopo: Choose two cards from your lab's deck, and give them to Savvy, who will treat them like the cards in "Samply".
Dedukto: Receive five molecule cards from Savvy. You (but not the other lab) now know these molecules are not in the antidote.
Centrofugo: Place your centrifuge on your lab worksheet so that it points to four molecules. Savvy then indicates whether any of these molecules are in the antidote.
Scanpad: Place a cardboard device on your worksheet to highlight six molecules in a 2x3 grid. Savvy then indicates how many molecules highlighted (0-3) are part of the antidote.
Spionado: Savvy takes two lab cards from the opposing lab that do not have any molecules in the antidote on them, then shows them to you.
Antidote: Circle three molecules on your worksheet. If all three are in the antidote, you win! If not, Savvy will indicate how many of the circled molecules are in the antidote.


Each lab has a limited number of actions in its deck — eighteen total, with three Samply, two Dedukto, one Scanpad, two Antidote, etc. — so use them wisely, especially the Antidote because if you fail to identify the correct three molecules a second time, then your lab loses the game automatically.

To play Save Patient Zero as a two-player game, each lab draws three molecule cards from the deck, and the opposing lab must identify these three molecules before you can identify the three molecules they drew. Each lab takes the role of Savvy for the opposing lab.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 7 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
SAVE PATIENT ZERO - Die Menschheit steht auf dem Spiel! Eine neue Krankheit ist aufgetaucht! Patient Zero wurde identifiziert. Es liegt an dir, das Gegenmittel so schnell wie möglich zu finden, um ihn und die ganze Menschheit zu retten. In Save Patient Zero spielt ihr als zwei Labore gegeneinander. Jedes Labor beschäftigt ein bis drei Wissenschaftler (d.h., die Spieler und Spielerinnen). Ein anderer Spieler übernimmt die Rolle des Laborcomputers »Savvy«.
Die Idee des Spiels ist es, die Laborwerkzeuge in der bestmöglichen Reihenfolge zu verwenden, um die drei Moleküle zu identifizieren, aus denen das Gegenmittel für die Krankheit besteht. Das Prinzip des Spiels Save Patient Zero ist einfach: Schritt für Schritt müsst ihr lernen, wie die Werkzeuge funktionieren. Dann könnt ihr den besten Weg finden, sie zu kombinieren und Patient Zero zu retten.
Das Ziel: Beide Labore konkurrieren darum, ein Gegenmittel zu fi nden, das aus 3 von 25 Molekülen besteht. Die allgemeine Idee des Spiels ist es, die Laborgeräte in der effi zientesten Reihenfolge zu verwenden. Wer das Gegengift zuerst fi ndet, gewinnt das Spiel. Ein Unentschieden ist nicht möglich.
Inhalt 2x30 Forschungsblätter, 2 Sichtschutze + zusätzliche Blätter mit Klammern für andere Sprachen, 2 Bleistifte, 2 Scanpads, 2 Estugamo Tokens, 2 Centrifugo Tokens, 1 Spielregelbuch,168 Karten: 24 Werkzeugkarten (Labo-M), 40 Probenkarten (Labo-M), 24 Werkzeugkarten (Labo-T), 40 Probenkarten (Labo-T), 25 Molekülkarten, 15 Unterbrechungskarten
https://youtu.be/Oi-bVdzVcuI
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR
played once

boardgame.name: Kids' Dungeons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Play with your children, it's finally possible! Introduce your children to role-playing games and stimulate their imagination with Kids' Dungeons, a role-playing game for children aged 3 to 8 years old.

The rules are extremely simple and has been specially designed to awaken your children to mathematical curiosity. Two fully compatible systems are possible:


youngest kids will have fun discovering numbers and comparing sizes.
older ones will be able to practise additions.


Explore dungeons with your children!
With the light class-based system, make kids feel like they're turning into heroes!
7 characters available
Put their reflection to the test with The Jail
Rediscover a lost childish fantasy sensation with the mini background World of Crystal Castle and its crazy bestiary.

Maximum recommended playing time 20-35 minutes. Further specific advice for playing with children is given in the book.

Start the adventure right away with The Great Bathroom Flooding, a ready-to-play scenario included in the book.

So go for it, brave adventurers! The adventure and its treasures are waiting for you!

boardgame.name: Torture Chambers
Torture Chambers 4K
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Folks disappear at night? What happens to them and why do those who come back prefer not to remember their experiences?

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes:
FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format (72dpi)

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk Apartment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

...his apartment was not in the best neighborhood, but it wasn't the worst either...

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes:
FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format (72dpi)

boardgame.name: Planet: Mythical Creatures
boardgame.description:
Planet Mythical Creatures Promo from BGG store (and later available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.)

Add a touch of magic to your perfect world with these fantastic animals!

These 5 new cards will replace 5 Animal Cards from your base game:

Replace the Eagle with the Roc
Replace the Panda with the Unicorn
Replace the Snake with the Dragon
Replace the Whale with the Kraken
Replace the Polar Bear with the Yeti

The five mythical creatures score exactly the same as their non-mythical counterparts.

Blue Orange publisher

boardgame.name: Qwixx: Bonus
boardgame.description:
Qwixx: Bonus consists of two new scorepads that provide twists on the normal way of playing Qwixx.

On one of the scorepads, the score sheet now includes twelve boxed spaces, with three boxes in each of the colored rows. Additionally, a row of twelve colored boxes lies below the colored rows. Whenever you cross off a boxed space, you cross off the next colored box in the row (e.g., a red box), then cross off the leftmost space of that color that you can legally mark off. This might cause a chain reaction, and it might cause you to complete a second row, which would then end the game.

On the other scorepad, ten spaces among the colored rows are marked with bonus boxes, with two each of five bonuses. When you mark off the second box of a particular bonus, you receive a special reward, such as crossing off the next two spaces of your row with the fewest marks, crossing off the next space of each active color, or doubling the score of your least valuable row at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: The Ooze and You!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Ooze And You! is a supplement for D&D 5e and Pathfinder 2e. I have detailed information about the many ooze that I have encountered on my journeys. This includes stat blocks, taming, and lore information along with great sketches for visual identification. I hope to share my research to encourage more adventurers to interact with these creatures in new ways and to show a whole new world of possibilities.

Now The Ooze And You! is not complete and more time is needed to compile my notes. But, with this preview, I hope I can manage to stir your curiosity enough to back our kickstarter, which launches Oct. 7 2020, and show your support for expanding the knowledge of ooze. As this is just the beginning of my work, feel free to share this preview far and wide to alert all other wanderers of this useful field guide.

boardgame.name: Dual Gauge
boardgame.description:
The title Dual Gauge refers to the fact that there are two kinds of track - standard gauge and narrow. Standard is more expensive and more efficient, while narrow gauge is cheaper and rather inefficient. These rectangular track tiles are laid across adjacent hexsides, and all companies are able to utilize a shared track network provided they are connected to it. Different types of track will of course call for different types of trains. Stock purchases put funds in the company coffers, and the company uses this money to pay for track. Trains, on the other hand, are paid for in stock value itself. Those trains can also be "rusted" by the purchase of newer models. Companies can also "token" station spaces on the map, increasing their routes while potentially blocking access for rivals. These, too, are paid for in stock value, by decreasing that value by an entire row in the game's capricious two-dimensional stock market.

This is not only a game, but a game system played on multiple maps. Each map has unique twists, and a set of companies with unique asymmetric abilities. This base set gets the party started with two maps. Portugal is intended as an introduction to the system, but asks players to contend with difficult mountainous terrain. The challenging Detroit map, set in part of Michigan's Lower Peninsula, finds players taking on debt to keep underfunded railroads afloat, all with an eye toward reaching Chicago and its double-route bonus.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: District Commander Kandahar
boardgame.description:
District Commander: Kandahar simulates the problems facing insurgent and counterinsurgent commanders in southern Afghanistan circa 2009-2010. This is not Brian Train's first or even second game about this conflict, and you might be wondering, what does this one have to offer? We think that the District Commander system - with its emphasis on bluff and deception, scarce resources and shifting operational goals - is an especially good fit for capturing the pace and nature of operations in Afghanistan.

Brian Train's District Commander is a series of operational games on counterinsurgency situations. The players alternate activation of groups of units (stacks) to perform discrete operations (missions) through the expenditure of Task Points (TP). Some missions are Tactical Missions - straightforward military tasks such as performing patrols, ambushing or attacking enemy forces, or moving from one place to another - and these may be performed multiple times by a stack during a turn. Other missions emphasize the "non-tactical" end of the campaign, establishing friendly influence, control, and infrastructure in an area, reducing the enemy's claim to the same, and recruiting or training troops. These missions take more time to perform and so unlike the tactical missions may be the only mission performed by the stack during the turn.

Missions are resolved by play of secretly-held Chance Chits, each with ratings that are better or worse for certain types of operations. Chits are played simultaneously and the ratings compared, modified by units, assets, and the current board state to determine the outcome. Using the right chit at the right time - knowing when to save a good chit for later and when to use it, and trying to determine if your opponent is going all-in or holding back - will require steely judgment in an atmosphere of doubt and deception.

All this is done in pursuit of objectives handed down to you by your superiors (i.e., chosen randomly) and kept secret from your opponent - objectives that may even change over the course of the game. Within this framework, the two sides - Government and Insurgent - play very differently, with the Insurgent player, in particular, depending on bluff and deception to achieve their goals. A large number of variant rules allow you to turn the game into a sandbox for exploring counterinsurgency doctrine and practice.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aurelian: Restorer of the World
boardgame.description:
The Roman Empire is broken. The crisis of the third century - a decades-long fever dream of civil war, plague, and economic ruin - stretched it thinner and thinner, until finally, inevitably, it splintered. The Palmyrene Empire to the east, the Gallic Empire to the west, and sandwiched between them, the remnants of the Roman Empire. Deprived of its richest provinces and stuck in a series of endless wars along the frontier, it seemed destined, at last, to fall. But in 270, when the emperor died, troops along the Danube did what troops along the Danube always did, and demanded that their commander take the purple. His name was Lucius Domitius Aurelianus, and over the course of his short reign, he would do the impossible: he would put this broken world back together again.

Aurelian, Restorer of the World is a solitaire game from Tom Russell, the designer of Agricola, Master of Britain and Charlemagne, Master of Europe. Like those titles, three cups are used to represent shifting attitudes toward Aurelian's rule; actions you take will move chits from one cup to another. This game is shorter and faster than the two previous games, lasting a maximum of six turns. It's also more difficult. Beyond marching around the map, quelling revolts, and smacking down usurpers, you must manage monies, maintain a strong defensive line along the Danube, make war against Germanic tribes, build up city defenses, and spread the cult of Sol Invictus. You do not have nearly enough time or resources to do all of these things equally well, and will need to make hard choices. If you succeed, you will earn the title afforded to Aurelian by the senate: Restitutor Orbis, "Restorer of the World".

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fight Sequence: The First Chapter
boardgame.description:
Fight Sequence is the tactical reverse action-programming dueling game about psychics THINKING about fighting! Players build sequences of attacks and responses that resolve in reverse order, representing the ebb and flow of a theoretical fantasy fight scene two psychics are projecting into each other's minds. Planning your own moves isn't the only key to victory; you'll also use your psychic and magical abilities to manipulate when - or IF - actions resolve!

Players select one of the four characters in a diverse cast of psychic combatants, using their unique skillsets to emerge victorious. Every character deck has its own strengths and weaknesses, with a depth of tactical play that ensures no two fights are the same.

In Fight Sequence, players take turns playing Actions or passing, building a series of Actions until both players pass consecutively [with passes being forced once the maximum sequence size of 9 Actions is met]. Once that happens, the entire sequence then resolves in reverse order, starting with the last Action played. Timing your Actions for maximum effect is crucial, but every character has some ability to manipulate that timing to work more in their favor. Even the best-laid plans aren't foolproof!

Actions are either attacks or responses - use your attacks to damage your opponent, and your responses to defend yourself from opposing attacks or support your strategy. Every card in the game can be played as either an attack or a response, so you're never out of options. Damage is represented by discarding cards from your deck; no paper, pen, dice, or tracker apps required. Just choose your characters, shuffle your decks, and begin!

In addition to four varied characters with different styles and movesets, The First Chapter also includes the Academy decks, which use a more streamlined subset of cards to help ease players into the reverse-action-programming nature of the game.

-- description from the designer
