boardgame.name: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Game (Spring 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You could do anything tonight: round up some friends, meet new ones, go anywhere, and enjoy any form of entertainment. But no… you choose a roleplaying game. Not just any roleplaying game, but The World’s Greatest Roleplaying Game. You are the moral compass, the firm hand gripping the sword, and the keen mind manipulating powerful spells, guiding the heroes in the worlds we create together. You are a player. You are all players.

Yet who are these players? Who gathers around tables or huddles before screens to play this game? What challenges do they seek, what itches need scratching? How do they approach the monsters and traps their characters face every session?

The World’s Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Game is a tabletop roleplaying game about players playing a game of 5e. Each player chooses a player type, or playbook, from those provided to represent some of the most common types of 5e players around the world. Many of these playbooks are based on the player types referenced in multiple editions of the actual world’s greatest roleplaying game. Each playbook provides players with a move triggered by an action in the 5e game that allows various…well, let’s be honest. Cheats.

You can choose a playbook best suited to your own personality or play style. You can choose a playbook that’s the opposite of your normal play style. Or you can be tactical and choose the playbook that best augments your 5e character’s abilities.

This is just one article found in our quarterly zine, The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine. Merging indie RPGs with the 5th Edition of... you know. Originally only available to backers of our Kickstarter campaign, there may be a secret door that will grant you access to a new way to play 5e.
boardgame.rpgissue: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine

boardgame.name: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: Detentions & Dragons (Summer 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the fantasy genre, there have been heroes who rose to the challenge and overcame great evil to spare us from demonic invations and arcane conquests. These worlds thrive on the powerful aid of their mightiest heroes... but only after they graduate with at least a 3.0 GPA.

Detentions & Dragons provides four new backgrounds that will help refocus your typical 5e fantasy campaign into a high school melodrama. None of these backgrounds are tied to particular classes, so don't shy away from having a preppy warlock, a jock wizard, a goth paladin, or a nerd barbarian!

This is just one article found in our quarterly zine, The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine. Merging indie RPGs with the 5th Edition of... you know. Originally only available to backers of our Kickstarter campaign, there may be a secret door that will grant you access to a new way to play 5e.
boardgame.rpgissue: The World's Greatest Roleplaying Game: The Zine

boardgame.name: Giant Monster Invasion!
boardgame.description:
A table-top wargame for 2 or more players. It’s all about giant monsters, big cities, monsters in big cities, monsters thrashing big cities…you get the jist of it. The core rules are less than a dozen pages, and there’s also a bare-bones rules-lite version of it. Regular updates with new monster packs, some expansion packs, and so on.

Honoring cinema’s greatest giant monsters!

—description from the publisher

Giant Monster Invasion! is a simple tabletop miniatures wargame intended for use with 5" - 7" models (adaptable to 3" - 4" models). The play area is constructed using available terrain and buildings. Figures are given in-game attributes and abilities based, primarily, on appearance and/or notoriety. A "monster point" mechanism is used to achieve team equality. Play proceeds in player turns (2 or more teams are allowed), taken sequentially. Rules primarily deal with monster movement and attacks. Play continues until a single team remains. Several advanced, optional rules are included.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Labyrinth of the Lurking Lepidopterae
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Will You Survive the Labile Labyrinth?

Four hundred gold pieces for escorting a caravan across a valley populated by butterfly people. Who could refuse that?
Of course, it won’t be that simple . The moth folk fiercely defend their valley with treacherous traps and bruising brigades. Not to mention the menacing mushroom men, weird temples, shape-changers, and the ominous Tower of the Screaming Virgins.

Things wouldn’t be so bad were it not for the quarrelsome, alcoholic, lustful and dishonest crew members who you will have to keep an eye on. Add the bad roads, broken wheels, stolen cargo, tactical ambushes… and the llamas. Oh dear.
Requires only the core Four Against Darkness book.

CONTENT WARNING: This adventure for Four Against Darkness contains adult humor, flamingos, and lecherous llamas.

boardgame.name: Who's the Hunter, Who's the Game
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 7-9

The jungle erased the Kingdom of Kazarana from this valley a millennia ago, leaving little of its glory. Now, only strange rune-covered pillars, fractured pieces of road jutting from the ground and the Temple of Jaku remain.

In recent years, these ruins have become a strange place of worship for a tribe of leshy. Although traditionally isolationists, the ruins here represent their hope that one day civilization will be vanquished by nature. Anyone bearing metal through their sacred forest is led to the temple and their inevitable demise.

boardgame.name: Pasapalabra Junior
boardgame.description:
Based on a TV game show shown on Spanish television, based on the original British format "The Alphabet Game".

Each team has to guess secrets words. The game objective is to obtain the major number of seconds in the different tests and use them in the last test PASPALABRA. This last test is a countdown where each team has to guess a word beginning with every letter of the alphabet and the team wins if they successfully complete the alphabetical track before their accumulated time runs out.

boardgame.name: Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat
boardgame.description:
Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat is a game of skirmish-based combat set in the Starcraft Universe. This game was created by Neuicon and Sean Daniels, and play-tested over a period of time. The rules are fun, exciting and very simple to understand. If you have ever played Dungeons and Dragons Miniatures or Star Wars Miniatures, then you should know what to expect.

-description from the publisher

The game is a fan-created, tabletop miniatures implementation of the universe of the eponymous video game. Starcraft: Tactical Miniatures Combat has been published in two editions; the 2nd edition contains refinements and some additional options. The game assumes players will have sufficient "Starcraft" miniatures to represent all units. Play proceeds in turn order until one team remains. Units are allocated by points; units are based on the videogame.

—user summary

boardgame.name: SpellCaster
boardgame.description:
SpellCaster is a magical and physical combat game for two or more players. Each player is represented by a Spell Caster, a warrior mage trained in the ways of combat and magic, skilled in powerful martial arts techniques and armed with a complete arsenal of spells. The goal is to defeat all others players and remain the last spell caster alive. SpellCaster uses ordinary playing cards, but is no ordinary card game as it combines hex/grid map strategy. Since the game uses poker cards, generic playing pieces and any plain hex or grid map it is easy to play and easy on the budget, unlike most any other collectible trading card game. SpellCaster uses a unique system of card combinations in preparing and casting spells.

—description from the publisher

SpellCaster requires at least two players, but accomodates more. Play requires a partially-stripped pack of French cards, tokens, and either a hex or a grid map. Play takes place in turns, played in sequence order. Player abilities during a turn partially are determined by card draw. Players attempt to eliminate other players by "casting spells" or making "attacks". The winner is the sole player remaining. Two expansion products were planned but not published.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: 2-Player Starter – Firewalker VS Treefolk
boardgame.description:
2-Player Starter Set- All the dice you need to begin your adventures! 66% more health than our previous starters! (30 health of each race and 4 Dragons!)

Bring the flaming might of the Firewalkers and the sturdy power of the Treefolk to your battlefield.

The Starter Set has all two players need to begin their campaign: 28 six-sided unit dice, 4 ten-sided monster dice; 4 eight-sided terrain dice; 4 twelve-sided dragon dice. It also contains two paper play mats and the Starter Rule Book. You can combine starter sets or add more dice from kicker packs to expand your armies.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 2 – Firewalkers
boardgame.description:
Firewalkers- Fury from above! The versatile Firewalkers bring their battlelust to the fray.

From the fiery sun, they have come to join the life-and-death struggle for dominance of a young world. They are the Firewalkers, elemental beings who have mysterious reasons for joining the fray. Can your armies harness the might of the Firewalkers and attain victory? Or will their creatues, such as the mighty Phoenix, destroy your troops itself?
This Kicker Pack contains new dice to flesh out your DRAGON DICE forces, all awesome Firewalkers and Monsters of stunning mottled red and blue.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of the red and blue Firewalkers, plus the original rules folder.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Dwarves
boardgame.description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah… and find that legends live!

The Dwarves have been on Esfah since the earliest ages. The power of Earth and Fire creates a hardy race born for the highlands. The Dwarves are tough and durable, and are fierce fighters on any terrain. Few races dare to challenge them in the mountains. Now available in a kicker pack, the Dwarves
also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary beast Behemoth, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of red and gold Dwarf, plus rules summary.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Coral Elves
boardgame.description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah…and find that legends live!

In the beginning, there were the Coral Elves. The power of Water and Air created a race that flourished on the coasts, and produced mages and marksman of great skill. In the battle for control of Esfah, the fleet Coral Elves have proved themselves through the ages. Now available in a kicker pack, the Coral Elves also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary beast Leviathan, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™.

Each Coral Elf kicker box contains a random assortment of 7 6-sided dice: 4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm. They also include 1 random 22mm 10-sided monster die and a rules sheet.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Goblins
boardgame.description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah… and find that legends live!

Death put forth his hand again and produced the Goblins to create more chaos on Esfah. This sturdy race of Earth and Death provided the shock troops for many a war in the land. Their power in melee and speed in the swamps enabled the Goblins to overrun many other races in the war for supremacy in Esfah. Now available in a kicker pack, the Goblins also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary abomination Cannibal, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of black and gold Goblin, plus rules summary.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Lava Elves
boardgame.description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah…and find that legends live!

The power of Lord Death, jealous of Nature, produced his own children. First came the Lava Elves, creatures of Fire and Death bred to conquer Esfah. With powerful magic and potent missiles, the unpredictable Lava Elves became the bane of the land, especially in their own Highlands. Now available in a kicker pack, the Lava Elves also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary Lurker in the Dark, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice™.

Each Lava Elf kicker box contains a random assortment of 7 6-sided dice: 4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm. They also include 1 random 22mm 10-sided monster die and a rules sheet.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Amazons
boardgame.description:
Return to the ancient days of creation in Esfah…and find that legends live!

Nature sought to gain advantage in the war again, bringing forth the swift and sure-handed Amazons. These fearsome female warriors and their War Chiefs raced across the fields of Esfah, raining missiles on the unwary and drawing on the elemental power of whatever terrain they trod. Now available in a kicker pack, the Amazons also bring their monstrous allies, including the legendary and frightening Nightmare, making its first appearance in Dragon Dice.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 3 – Undead
boardgame.description:
What happens in Esfah when the carnage continues to escalate? Lord Death raises the Undead to step into the battle for supremacy on the Dragon Dice field. SFR, Inc. is pleased to announce the return of the Undead in a new kicker pack. With this kicker, one of Dragon Dice™’s most popular species is again available for your game. Zombies, Skeletons, Vampires, Ghouls, Dracoliches, and other not-quite-dead-yet units await your commands!

The Undead are a powerful species in melee combat, combining strong offensive power with superior toughness. Undead mages come in two kinds, heavy and light magic, and use Black/Death magic to devastating effect with their own set of spells to add to the regular spell book. With their racial abilities, the Undead are hard to kill and harder to keep dead. Unlike the other speciesin the game, Undead have no missile units, so you’ll want to play to their strengths and crush those pesky archers.

Each Undead kicker box contains a random assortment of 7 6-sided dice: 4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm. They also include 1 random 22mm 10-sided monster die and a rules sheet.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 4 – The Feral
boardgame.description:
Feral- Nature raises up the beasts to fight on her behalf! The Feral are a fierce and prolific race.

Includes 1 10-sided Elder (monster) die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of the blue and gold Feral.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 5 – Swamp Stalkers
boardgame.description:
A new horror arises to challenge the ancient powers in Esfah!

From the fetid swamps of Esfah, the Swamp Stalkers slithered into the battles that raged in the land. Fearsome mutants created by Death from other species, these creatures of Water and Death bring powerful melee troops and the magic of death and decay with them. Jagged swords, hurled forks, and reptilian eyes abound as these foul abominations roam your battlefields. Can you harness the horror of these swamp troops and their allied monsters to roll to victory in Esfah?

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of black and green Swamp Stalkers.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 6 – Frostwings
boardgame.description:
Frostwings- This kicker puts the flight speed and deadly missile strength of the Frostwings under your command.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of blue and black Frostwings, plus the updated rules folder.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 7 – Scalders
boardgame.description:
Once the fire starts, there's no quenching it! Nature stretched out her hand once more, but neither she nor Death could control her newest creations. The forgotten children of Nature. Scalders now bring their desire to set the world aflame to your battlefields. Creatures of fire and water, their flaming clubs, fiery arrows, and steaming charms provide a wild new race to command. Now you can harness the wrath of the Scalders and their allied monsters to scorch your way to victory in Esfab!

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of red and green Scalders, plus the updated rules folder.

boardgame.name: Skull Crusher
boardgame.description:
Skull Crusher is a game for anyone who...has a pile of half painted plastic and metal miniatures taunting him from the shelf...Skull Crusher is a fantasy skirmish wargame that has no illusions about itself. It's full rules fill a whole four pages. It has no "pseudo-historical" backstory. It's probably family friendly as long as it isn't played while drunk. It welcomes all fantasy miniatures into play, regardless of origin, base, or painted condition.

-description from the publisher

Skull Crusher is a lightweight, tabletop miniatures wargame for two teams. Opposing armies contains units purchased from a points pool. Individual units are equipped with "whatever can actually be seen" - and such equipment adds to the point cost of the unit. Attacks are made with whatever type of equipment the unit has, including mêlée or ranged attacks. Play proceeds in turns, with players alternating. Unit movement is performed in inches - if the play area is using terrain, it must be navigated around. Units receiving enough damage are removed from play. The game is won by the player who is not eliminated.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: White Dragons Expansion
boardgame.description: White Dragons - White dragons are much tougher that normal dragons. They have double the health (10) and do twice as much damage. In other words, Claws do 12 points, Wings do 10 points, Tails do 6 (and reroll), Jaws do a whopping 24 points! Even the Treasure is twice as much, allowing 2 units to promote. However, there is a price for this; a white dragon replaces 2 normal dragons and takes twice as much magic to summon. So in a 36-health game, you could either bring 2 normal dragons or 1 white dragon. Any color dragon summoning spell can summon a white dragon, however, it takes 14 points of magic instead of 7. See the rules for more information.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 8 – Treefolk
boardgame.description:
Treefolk- Nature again strengthens her children with the steady toughness of the Treefolk.

Includes 1 10-sided monster die and 7 6-sided unit dice (4 small 16mm, 2 medium 18mm, and 1 large 20mm) of green and gold Treefolk, plus rules folder.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Acolytes of Eldarim Expansion
boardgame.description:
The mysterious Eldarim have begun to teach their singular elemental skills to a few chosen Acolytes, who have abandoned their species traditions to become a new species in Esfah. Your battles will be enhanced by using the powerful Dragonmasters and Dragonhunters, the single-element Acolytes of the Eldarim, and the protective Dragonkin whose elemental nature links them with the Eldarim.

This kicker pack contains Acolytes of Eldarim: 6 small 16mm Acolytes, 3 medium 18mm Acolytes, and 2 large 20mm Acolytes; in a random assortment of types and colors.

Champions of this species are sold separately.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Battle Chest Expansion
boardgame.description:
As the generals of Esfah scramble for an edge in their battles, mystic items, each tied to one of the five elements of Esfah, emerge from treasure troves scattered throughout the land. Mighty weapons and shields, fleet footwear, and magical charms find the hands of those willing to wield them. Now you can harness the power of items and artifacts to assist your armies in their efforts to vanquish your foes.

Each Battle Chest contains a random assortment of 6 single-colored 4-sided items of 5 types and 5 colors in 3 different sizes. It also contains 2 single-colored 10-sided artifacts of 5 types and 5 colors.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Battlefields Expansion
boardgame.description:
With Battlefields, the Dragon Dice general now has more options for shaping his battlefield. This expansion includes new basic terrains: the Feylands(Fire and Water) and the Wastelands (Fire and Air); and new special frontier terrains: the Castle, Dragon Lair, Grove and Vortex; to add a new layer of strategy to your battlefield choices at the start of a game. You can also alter the battlefield during play with the use of minor terrains, lesser objectives that may give your army a needed boost if you're willing to take a risk.

Box contains 7 terrain dice: 1 Feyland terain in random mix of 8 types, 1 Wasteland terrain in random mix of 8 types, 2 special terrains in random mix of Coastland,Flatland,Highland and Swamplands in 4 types and 3 minor terrains in random mix of all 6 terrain colors and 4 types.

Use of this expansion requires the Dragon Dice Starter Set and Dragon Dice Standard Rules.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Deadlands Expansion
boardgame.description: The Deadlands minor terrains are black and ivory. By giving up a maneuver attempt, you can add these to any terrain (ivory matches all colors). That adds black to the terrain color for your army only! 4 dice in this set, 1 of each type.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragon Sets Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is for all 6 color combinations of Hybrid and Ivory Hybrid dragons that match the options picked

Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons. Composed of two elements, they have both elements in their very makeup. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army and both elements of army breath effects against the army. However, the dragons are affected by both elements as well. A Dragon Summoning spell of either element will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions that match either element can affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of either element also affect them normally. Dragonkin of either matching element cannot be rolled when attacked by an Hybrid dragon. Hybrid Dragons fight all dragons (except pure ivory dragons and ivory hybrids with a matching elemental) that do not match their elements exactly. Elemental and White dragons fight all Hybrid Dragons.

Ivory Hybrid Dragons:
These dragons are hybrids of the elemental dragons and an ivory dragon. Composed of one element and ivory, they have that element in their very makeup, plus all the attributes of the ivory dragons. They generate breath against 5 health of the defending army and the elemental army breath effect (if any) against the army. A Dragon Summoning spell of any element (reflecting their ivory nature) will summon them to a terrain. Eldarim Champions of a single element that matches the dragon’s elemental can affect them normally. White Eldarim Champions affect them normally. Dragon Staffs and Dragonkin Champions of the same element as the dragon also affect them normally. Just like pure ivory dragons, dragonkin cannot be rolled when attacked by an Ivory Hybrid dragon. Like the pure ivory dragons, once summoned to a terrain, no ivory Dragon Summoning spell can move them. However, a Dragon Summoning spell of their element can move them. Ivory hybrid dragons, like pure ivory dragons, always attack the army at the terrain. However, they are attacked by all hybrid dragons that do not have a matching element. Elemental dragons not matching the ivory hybrid dragon’s element and white dragons attack all ivory hybrid dragons.

boardgame.name: Lone General
boardgame.description:
We all like games, but the problem is most of them can't be played alone. And war games are the worst, because they have long set-up times, in addition to needing at least two people and a lot of pieces...So, lets make a war game to play by yourself.

-description from the designer

Lone General is a solitaire wargame. The game assumes suitable unit figures are available. The print-and-play rules provide a method of determining and distributing enemy units (all pre-defined), then having those units act/react from among established options. Every game involves four armies and six fronts, offering multiple starting positions. The game uses fairly simple rules to support movement, terrain, morale, rallying, and various other standard components of wargaming.

The game, fully developed in under 24-hours for a time-restricted design competition, has a few rough edges.

-user summary

boardgame.name: Terror Town RPG
boardgame.description:
Terror Town RPG is a simple solo game wherein all rules of gameplay are included in a single character sheet. In the game, the player takes the role of a person trapped in the evil Terror Town, a ghost town whose legend claims a corrupt mayor sacrificed the souls of his entire town in order to gain power and eternal life in a dark dimension of pure evil. Now, the town exists in three different worlds at once: Our World, Grey World, and Dark World. In our world, you will find weapons and other useful items. In Dark World, you will find twisted monsters out to kill you. In Grey World, you will find both. Can you survive the survival horror challenge of Terror Town? Will you escape the doomed town, defeat it’s diabolical mayor, or just end up falling victim to it’s many monsters? The answer awaits you... in Terror Town.

—description from the publisher

Despite its name, Terror Town RPG is not a role-playing game. The procedural, solitaire game is played in a series of turns, each turn presenting a challenge to overcome. If successful, a random die roll determines what the next turn will bring. The player starts with two pools of points - Escape and Life - which vary during play. Escape points are used to avoid certain situations; Life points are depleted by failure. If Life ever reaches zero, the game is lost - otherwise the game ends in success when the player escapes Terror Town.

The print-and-play game rules are presented in tiny typeface on a single page of paper; three pages of cut-out tokens also are provided.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Firefly: The Game – Regina Loot Crate
boardgame.description:
Regina Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Osiris Shipworks Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Regina Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

boardgame.name: Firefly: The Game – Space Bazaar Loot Crate
boardgame.description:
Space Bazaar Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Regina Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Space Bazaar Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

boardgame.name: Dave the Barbarian
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is the story of a long and distant age. An age of monsters, savagery, sorcery, adventure, and great and noble barbarian heroes. And at the heart of this age lies the land of Udrogoth, a kingdom of great fantasy and mystery. Of foul monsters and brave heroes. This story…features none of them. Instead, this story revolves around the royal family of Udrogoth and their various inane exploits and adventures, as narrated by The Storyteller.

boardgame.name: Firefly: The Game – Osiris Loot Crate
boardgame.description:
Osiris Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Silverhold Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Osiris Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

boardgame.name: Firefly: The Game – Persephone Loot Crate
boardgame.description:
Persephone Loot Crate promo card supplied with Firefly Adventures: Brigands and Browncoats.

This card is from the Space Bazaar Deck and is played as follows:

Remove from play to use: Draw a card from the Persephone Supply Deck. If it is a Gear Card, keep it. If not, discard it and draw another card. Repeat until a Gear Card is drawn

boardgame.name: RuneScape
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

There exists five beings known as the Elder Gods who have created, destroyed, and then created new universes since time immemorial. Upon creating a perfect world where the Anima Mundi is in such a state that it nourishes the Elder Gods, they burrow deep beneath to the heart of the world and sleep. Upon being reborn on that world once they have taken in a sufficient amount of Anima, they awake to begin the cycle all over again. This is how it was and will be since existence began.

boardgame.name: 26 Ways
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

26 Ways is a Role Playing Game with a Word Game nestled at its heart. 26 Ways provides a framework for role-playing stories in a made-up world. At key points in the developing story, you’ll answer the question – What Happens Next? – and what you say goes. There’s a catch. You can only narrate actions derived from words starting with a single letter of the alphabet. Every time you act, the letter changes. You’ll have to think fast, and be creative, to find a way to express what you want to have happen. So bring your imagination… and mind your Ps and Qs.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonkin
boardgame.description:
This is the dragonkin expansion. Text on the back of the box:

The mysterious Eldarim have begun to teach their singular elemental skills to a few chosen Acolytes, who have abandoned their species traditions to become a new species in Esfah. Your battles will be enhanced by using the powerful Dragonmasters and Dragonhunters, the single-element Acolytes of the Eldarim, and the protective Dragonkin whose elemental nature links them with the Eldarim.

Eldarim Expansion: Dragonkin; Box contains 6 common dragonkin, 3 uncommon dragonkin, 2 rare dragonkin, and 1 dragonkin champion in a random assortment of types and colors.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragoncrusader / Dragonzealots
boardgame.description:
Dragonzealots- These powerful warriors are strong enough to control the wild dragons. The Crusaders protect their armies with their mighty shields. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragoncrusader.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonlord / Dragonmasters
boardgame.description:
Dragonmasters - Dragonmasters are 4-health units that are part of the Eldarim species and come in five different colors, but are virtually identical to the Dragonlord. They have several advantages and disadvantages when compared to the Dragonlord. The Dragonmaster can only cast magic of the same color as itself. Dragonmasters can carry medallions and magical items matching their color. A Dragonmaster can tame dragons of the same color if it rolls its SFR Logo during the dragon attack. During the retreat step of a reserve movement, a Dragonmaster can "ride" a tamed dragon to any other terrain. A Dragonmaster's logo acts as a 2-point ID.

A Dragonlord can do all the same as a Dragonmaster, but it works on any color dragon (including white dragons). It can cast any color of magic. It's logo does nothing in a normal army roll.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Eldarim Expansion – Dragonslayer/Dragonhunters
boardgame.description:
Dragonhunters- These secretive warriors live to battle the evil dragons. Not just powerful fighters, the Hunters can protect the armies with which they seek glory. Five colors-black, blue, gold, green, and red. This item is for a set of each of the five different colors, plus the white Dragonslayer.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Medallion
boardgame.description: Medallions- The mystic medallions are metallic magic items which can be carried by any unit. They provide powerful abilities to the army fortunate enough to hold one. Three alloys-gold, silver, and bronze.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dracolem Champion Promo
boardgame.description: This promotional die is an alternate version of the Draco-Champion, the Special Action Icon 'Major Gate' has been replaced with the SFR Inc. company logo. A Draco-Champion is the Heavy Melee Champion of the lost Dracolem species. Before they suddenly vanished from Esfah the Dracolem were sentient alloy based golems created in ancient times by the Gnomes to mimic and improve the native Dragonkin beasts. The Draco-Champion is packed full of special action icons which deal both powerful melee attacks against your opponents as well as save against damage done to it!

boardgame.name: Ghosts Love Candy: Kidthulhu Promo
boardgame.description:
Promo Kid Card (100) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

5
While KIDTHULHU is in the neighborhood, turn order is resolved from lowest to highest after players reveal their selected ghosts.

boardgame.name: Ghosts Love Candy: Chicken Promo
boardgame.description:
Promo Kid Card (101) included when ordering base game from Steve Jackson.

20
If the CHICKEN is still in the neighborhood at the end of the game, the last player who haunted her may take 1 candy from any kid in the neighborhood.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Elemental Relic
boardgame.description:
RELICS

Relics are large, non-elemental, metalic six-sided items. These ancient items are created from Eldrymetallum, a metal not native to Esfah.

Relics adhere to the same rules as items, described above, with two exceptions:
- As Relics are non-elemental, any unit may carry and use a Relic.
- A Relic is considered to be two items for the purposes of how many items a unit can carry and use.

Elemental Relic
- When rolled with an army, the Elemental Relic icon indicates which element units must contain to be affected by the relic. The SFR Logo contains all elements and ivory.
- Multiple Elemental Relics in an army may cancel each other. Elemental Relics that roll the same element have no effect on that roll. Note that the SFR logo matches all elements.

Elemental Relic
During any non-maneuver roll, X health-worth of matching units in the army carrying this relic may be re-rolled once, ignoring the previous result, OR, you may recruit or promote X health-worth of matching units from your DUA to the army carrying this relic. Results may be split between recruiting, promoting, and re-rolling in any way you choose. Any promotions happen all at once.

boardgame.name: Ro Sham Bo
boardgame.description:
Venture into the world of Ro Sham Bo.

The two player strategic board game where you collect wondrous artifacts to outwit your opponent and defeat them in battle.

There are two types of Artifacts to choose from, tactfully traverse the board to collect these artifacts and use their power to give you positioning and combat advantages.

Combat is engaged in close quarters through an attack and then counter phase.

Use the Artifacts you collected to tactically turn tables. The true spirit is being able to chain these artifacts with one another.

Do you have what it takes to go hand to hand?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Les Trois Portails
boardgame.description:
LES TROIS PORTAILS is a game of medium complexity, a wargame in which you are the hero! It allows you to relive the epic of the Land of Alhandra, more exactly, the invasion of the chaos it undergoes by opening 3 magic portals.

With a 16-page booklet of illustrated rules and scenario add-ons, a system inspired by that of ARS BELLUM, but introducing characters, magic, objects, flyers and monsters, it is fully immersed in the Heroic-Fantasy world.

The Land of Alhandra is made up of ancient races (men, greenhorns, dwarves, elves) who are experiencing the rebirth of the forces of Darkness, embodied by the Lich King Alach Zhur, and the invasion of chaos.

The player delivers the battles of the scenarios on A4 cards (A3 later) that make up "The Great Campaign" (the story of the invasion of chaos).

The game is played in pairs, one game lasts about 1 to 2 hours. You can choose to embody one side or the other (Darkness or Empire), or alternate roles. Each scenario is independent and constitutes a small battle, but it is also a stage in the story that is told to you.

The units (leaders or combat units) have a movement and combat capability (possibly including firepower) and represent 500 to 1000 or 2000 men, a dozen or twenty monsters, an illustrious character or hero.

The system is based on the initiative conquered by players following a die roll and the impact of leaders and/or other modifiers in the scenario. Scenario speed and ease of understanding are favored. The player starts with basic units, he enriches his pool as the scenario progresses with other units, additional spells and characters.

In THE THREE PORTALS, the system is based on the skills of the units that bring the player's character or armies, and on the development of his main character or armies.

The basic module of the game gives the essential rules and the scenarios are the preamble of the story; the extensions are groupings of scenarios around one or more new features (new race, new characters, additions of objects or various attributes).
A general map in the basic module will be completed as the game progresses.

Usually, extensions include 4 additional battles, a counter board, additional maps, items, spells, the author works on additional locations.

The rulebook
16 pages of illustrated rules, simple concepts and fun play system effectively allowing the simulation of historical dimension of battles.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Participez à une épopée fantastique sur la terre d'Alhandra ! Accomplissez les desseins des forces des ténèbres, ou prenez en main le destin de l'Empire et des races anciennes... Un wargame dont VOUS êtes le héros !

Le livret de règles
16 pages de règles illustrées, des concepts simples et la possibilité de jouer avec plaisir tout en simulant avec efficacité la dimension historique des batailles

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Realms of the Occult
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Virtual box set covering the supernatural and horror areas of the Marvel Comics Universe for the Marvel Super Heroes RPG created by TSR.

This "box set" consists of three volumes:
- Grandmaster's Log: Covering the Marvel Supernatural worlds and character creation, including new rules and options for character creation!

- Lights in the Darkness: Profiles of heroic Marvel magic users, supernatural hunters, and other supernatural heroic characters.

- Watcher's Chronicle: The other half... the evil magic users, supernatural creatures, and other nasties that would challenge your heroes.

boardgame.name: Runa & Ulfgar's Compendium of Big Boss Epic Goblins
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Sixteen of the toughest, weirdest, and interesting goblin bosses to encounter across the Forgotten Realms. In addition to three unique magical items, and three goblinoid sidekicks to take the goblin chaos along with you!

boardgame.name: BlackOut
boardgame.description:
"A difficult job needs the best worker"
BlackOut P&P, you need to find an electrical coordinator capable of maintaining stability in the electrical power system and avoiding a blackout.

boardgame.name: The Mad Manor of Astabar (5E)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For twenty years Astabar’s Manor sat abandoned, gaining notoriety as a cursed place of magic and danger. The good folk of Havehollow avoid it at all costs but at the behest of a beautiful and mysterious bard the characters venture forth to explore the home of the once great wizard.

User summary:

A revised version of Mini Quest: The Mad Manor of Astabar.

boardgame.name: Sacrifice of Innocence
boardgame.description:
A Prelude to Lost Mine of Phandelver

From the introduction:

Inspired by Matt Colville's Running the Game video series, this mini-adventure is designed to help a small group of new players level up their characters so they don't get slaughtered at the beginning of Lost Mine of Phandelver. They should gain enough experience to advance to 2nd level before attempting Goblin Arrows.

boardgame.name: Something's Cooking (5E)
boardgame.description:
A Prelude to Lost Mine of Phandelver

From the introduction:

When Andolyn met Gendrew, it seemed a match made in heaven. Andolyn was a skilled wizard with a love of a good meal, looking for an excuse to settle down from adventuring, while Gendrew was a master chef looking to create new methods of cooking. Together, they took up a quiet life of baking and brewing, content to live in a small cottage on the outskirts of town.

User summary:

This is a fan-created adaptation of Something's Cooking. The re-use of this intellectual property appears to be copyright infringing.

boardgame.name: Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Where everything seems possible and nothing is what it seems.

A one shot adventure for Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition paying homage to the iconic David Bowie film by the same name.

boardgame.name: Ill Gotten Gains
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is designed for a party of 5 first level adventurers and aims to be 2 to 4 hours in length. The adventure is designed with newer players in mind who may not have much experience with DnD 5E or Final Fantasy XIV. It has been written to make session preparation as simple as possible by providing references and maps where possible. As always, this module is a framework and can be adjusted as you see fit to fit your table and play style.

boardgame.name: The Salvation of Korthos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Two years prior the the events in the Salvation of Korthos, a colony of Mind Flayers discovered a lost Quori artifact... something called a Mindsunder. They soon discovered that this giant green crystal could amplify psionic powers beyond the measure of any artifact they had encountered before. The discovery of the Mindsunder meant a new path for the Mind Flayer colony to the Grand Design - the endeavor to rebuild their lost empire which was overthrown during the Great Revolts thousands of centuries ago. Arrogant Darastrix Achthend immediately took to investigating the Mindsunder as a way to re-establish their Mindflayer Empire.
...
This is an adventure adapted from the Dungeons & Dragons Online video game. The PCs begin at level 1 and should be level 3 by the time they reach Misery's Peak.

User summary:

This fan-created scenario uses intellectual property in a manner that infringes copyright protections.

boardgame.name: Trivia Trolls
Виктроллина
boardgame.description:
The first party trivia game that embarrasses your friends through the art of trolling.

On each turn, one person draws a clue card and reads the category to their teammates. The teammates select the clue difficulty they want, 1 point being easy, 2 points being medium, and 3 points being hard.

The opposing team then has the opportunity to play a troll card or a trap card to add an extra layer of difficulty. Troll cards are played face up. They can make players do things like “sing the clue in their best opera voice,” “read the clue while smiling through clenched teeth,” “read the clue in their best Australian accent” “read the clue with a mouthful of water” or “text the clue using only emojis” to name just a few. Trap cards are played face down and revealed after the clue is read. They can make teams skip turns or lose points.

If a troll card or trap card is played, the answering team has the opportunity to play defense with a trench card. Trench cards can negate troll and trap cards, award extra points or give extra turns.

Once all troll, trap, or trench cards have been played for the round. The clue is read, hilarity ensues, points are awarded (or not) and then the next team draws their clue. The first team to 11 points wins! Let the trolling commence!

Happy Trolling friends!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rift Knights
boardgame.description:
In a clifftop monastery, an ancient order of holy knights watches over a sealed portal to the underworld. The knights must protect the elders—ancient sages who sustain the seal. Every year during the long night of the winter solstice, when the power of darkness is at its greatest, the seal weakens enough for a few demons to break through. Once inside, the monsters seek to battle past the valiant knights and slay enough of the elders to fully break the seal. Imbued with the power of the gods, only these sacred knights stand a chance at stopping an army of monsters from flooding into the world.

Rift Knights is an asymmetrical team game for 2 to 6 players. One team controls the holy knights, who must protect the elders and withstand the demons until dawn. The other team controls the demons, who seek to break the seal to the underworld before morning.  

During the game, you choose a unique knight or demon, each with a variety of special powers, such as the Flame Knight’s ability to surround his foes in fire, or the Bone Crusher’s power to summon skeletal minions. You also play cards from your hand to perform actions each turn, and each card can be used in three different ways. Careful planning with these cards is rewarded with memorable, game-changing moments. A set of unique location tiles allows you to create the monastery with a different layout every game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gooseriders of Haruunk
boardgame.description:
"The first in our Drop-in Foes series, add Haruunk, goblin god of annoyance and petty theft, to your adventures.

Followers of Harrunk can be enemies, allies, or even player characters in your next campaign. The Gooseriders of Haruunk contains everything to drop them in your game.

Background on Haruunk and their goals
A warlock pact with Haruunk
New spells and items themed around geese
And new creatures."

(User Summary)

boardgame.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Laserox Rune Lords Organizer
boardgame.description:
This organizer helps you store your cards in order, so you only can focus on playing.
Rune Lords Organizer designed for Pathfinder, it fits expansions:

Rise of the Runelords
Skull & Shackles
Wrath of the Righteous
Mummy's Mask


Rune Lords Organizer features:

removable dice tray (adjustable for more dice)
9 adjustable dividers
supports sleeved cards
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Skull & Shackles – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

boardgame.name: JELL-O Jiggler Slap Game
boardgame.description:
"LEFT HAND... LIME!" Listen for the JELL-O flavor that's read out loud, then be the quickest to slap your hand-- the CORRECT hand-- on the corresponding JELL-O Jiggler card.
If a "Jiggle!" card is called out, you must jiggle and wiggle for the flavor you savor. You'll love this quick-thinking, hand-slapping game from everyone's favorite jiggly treat. There's always room for this JELL-O gelatin game!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

boardgame.name: Explore: Tomb of Rasha
boardgame.description:
Co-op game for 2 players (can be played solo)
Tomb of Rasha is a cooperative game where you have to explore a tomb in a team of 2 players and defeat the snake queen Rasha. The game is played with a 54-card deck.

Story:
After the kingdom of Falladin defeated the evil snake queen Rasha, her creatures buried her deep into a tomb. There she lies for centuries, almost forgotten to the outside world. Until creatures of the depth came crawling out of the tomb and disturbed the nearby kingdom. Two adventurers where asked to go into the tomb to see what has happened. For it seems that Rasha might have awakened.

boardgame.name: KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game
boardgame.description:
Satisfy your cravings with the KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game! Roll the dice and add them together, then play the noodle cards that match. Keep an eye on Cheesasaurus Rex as he boosts his way higher up the Noodle Meter, but make sure you don't run out of noodles! The first person to play all of their cards OR the last person with leftover noodles is the mac & cheese winner! It's cheesy goodness your family will love!

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

boardgame.name: HEINZ Ketchup Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Roll the dice and collect as much ketchup as possible to try and score 57 points! But beware, if you get too greedy for the taste of HEINZ ketchup you could lose everything! Mustard and Sweet Relish bring an added level of flavor to the game, but can serve as penalties in your quest to roll the best. It's HEINZ ketchup or BUST in this press your luck game of risk versus reward! America's Favorite Ketchup game is definitely worth the wait.

—description from the back of the box

This is one of the three games included in the "Variety Game Pack" box from Big G Creative.

boardgame.name: Clue: Riverdale
boardgame.description:
The idyllic town of Riverdale has a secret. You must discover WHO killed Jason Blossom, WHAT weapon they used, and WHERE they killed him. Take on the roles of your favorite Riverdale characters to solve the mystery.

Contents:
Custom Game Board
6 Suspect Movers
6 Personality Cards
21 Rumor cards
18 Intrigue Cards
Custom Score pad
Envelope
6 Custom Zinc Tokens
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

listing.notes: Looks unplayed but box shows some wear.

boardgame.name: 1942 Flip Roll & Write
boardgame.description:
During the Pacific War of World War II our fighter will have to destroy the Japanese air fleet located in one of Japan's most important cities, but during the trip we will encounter enemy aircraft that will try to thwart our mission.

1942 is a flip & write where you must defeat different enemies that come out of a deck of cards.

With a few scroll mechanisms, new cards will appear and disappear at the same time.

Your mission is to make the maximum number of points by defeating planes, ships and other enemies, until you reach the enemy base and destroy it.

During the game, bonuses may appear on the cards that will give you combos or new weapons.

The final objective is to reach Tokyo with the highest possible score.

The game can be played in solo or 2-player mode.

The game is available in Print & Play.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Carcosa Rising
boardgame.description:
Carcosa Rising is the first expansion for Four against the Great Old Ones. It is based mainly on Mythos-related materials from Chambers and Bierce, drawn directly from the original sources.

The disturbances caused by the upcoming Great Ritual have started to tear apart the fabric of reality, and well-known places have already been replaced by a distorted version of themselves coming from other dimensions. Meanwhile, the King in Yellow and its agent, the Pallid Mask, are manipulating events from behind the curtain, and poisoning the very thoughts of unsuspecting people. And who is the mysterious plump man that appears to be following the group?

Carcosa Rising includes a new Investigator class (the Dreamer), three alternative versions of locations from the basic game, an entire new location (Carcosa), three event tables for traveling, possible attacks from the Pallid Mask (who takes control of the body of Investigators gone Insane), and a final Encounter with the King in Yellow.

This is a non-standalone expansion. Players can choose to add any combination of elements from Carcosa Rising to the base game, mixing and matching materials to ensure that no two games will be the same.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Four against the Great Old Ones

boardgame.name: Roll In One
boardgame.description:
Use a variety of clubs [dice] to drive, chip, putt, slice, and hook your way around a player-made golf course. Use the terrain to your advantage if you can, and a set of helpful Caddie Cards, to be the first to complete each hole.

Roll In One is a quick and casual dice golfing game for 1-5 players! Design simple yet challenging holes, filling your course with fairways, sand traps, and water hazards, seeing who can reach the green first.

Take turns choosing a die and rolling to see how far your ball flies. Each die is like a different club; the D4 like a putter, and the D20 a driver. Move forward as your rolls keep succeeding. The kicker: you MUST keep rolling until you fail. Don't choose the D20 unless you want to go far. Dice have various other sides, some which turn the ball, get stuck in trees, or won’t roll on fairways.

You’ve practiced your swing and are eager to hit the fairway, but do you have what it takes to get a Roll in One?

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Thinkers: Причина и Следствие
boardgame.description:
Set #4: "Cause and Effect" of the Thinkers series of board games will allow children of primary school age to learn to draw logical conclusions in various non-standard situations. The skills obtained as a result of the game will not only increase social adaptability but also lay the foundation for further personal development. Most of the items on the cards in this set are short stories that tell the background of a fact. The players are asked to determine exactly why this or that consequence took place, and what was its cause. Here are just a few examples of the 100 tasks that players will have to solve in this set:

- In which country are only men citizens?
- In the English city of Bradford, there is the only farm in the world where samples of woolen fabrics are delivered from all UK textile factories. Who is bred on this farm?
“What is the use of a tape recorder of a tiger's growl at Bombay Airport?
- In the American state of Arizona, they began to protect the desert from thieves. They steal something without which the desert is threatened with desolation and devastation. what is taken out of the desert?
- Walter Scott said: "Both the crystal and the heart would not be so valuable if ..."

Any number of participants can play the Thinkers board game, but if there are a large number of players, it would be advisable to split into teams. The teams, in turn, take one card with the task, which indicates the topic, difficulty, i.e. the number of victory points, and the task itself. After that, all team members jointly begin the discussion. The complexity of the tasks varies from one to five points, so the developer recommends to allot from 3 to 15 minutes to find solutions, respectively. The team can check the correctness of its answer on the reverse side of the card, then move on to the next team. At the request of the participants, the game can last for a certain time or end immediately after one of the teams scores a predetermined number of points.

boardgame.name: Градус
boardgame.description:
Degree: competition for adults only!
Board Game Box Degree Want to diversify your party or any gathering in your home of up to ten people who are already 18 years old? Maybe you just need to liberate the participants of your corporate team building?

With the board game Gradus, you will not only diversify your fun but also get an unforgettable sensation and experience with a touch of the piquancy of adult competition. But what can I say: the roof will blow away completely from jokes, gags, eroticism, and alcohol. Everyone will play the board game Gradus because you simply won't be able to get out!

Hit the table with a Degree!
Before the start, all players receive tablets, presented by the designer in the form of beer mugs, and tokens with the volume of alcohol consumed to record their achievements in conventional alcoholic drinks. Do you want to be limited to conventional alcohol and liters? Prepare thoroughly: a few bottles of pleasure and a good snack will not be superfluous. Companies of teetotalers can simply eat well and drink tea.

The set includes 6 decks of cards with different themes:
Basic - it is also basic and participates in all mixes;
Alkotresh - the name speaks for itself, so the tasks are tied to the "alcohol" part;
Move your body - tasks from this deck will crush your bodies sitting at the table;
Tin - the special coolness of the tasks will blow anyone's mind;
Spicy - a little eroticism will not hurt;
Brain ON - don't want to move your body - move your brains. Components of the game Degree

It is recommended to use no more than three task decks in one game party, shuffling two more decks from the base one if desired. A menu with a standard section and a part of wishes is also available for players.

The goal of each player is to reach the liter or two-liter value on their tablet by drinking or drinking points. Points are awarded after completing a specific task.

So, you are in an entertainment establishment, and just burn with the desire to drink! Wait for your turn and, in the clockwise direction, make a move: take a card from the general deck and announce your task to all participants. If you successfully complete the task, you will receive a point by noting the amount taken internally on the tablet. Please note that if you refuse to fulfill the conditions, then you drink a free "penalty" for which points are not awarded.

During the game, you can use the menu once and drink your points to order any dish for another participant. The standard section is available at any time during the game, and the Wish Menu is available after completing the task. If the victim of your choice did not complete the task, then, like all losers, he drinks a "penalty", while receiving the right to use the Menu for free.

The board game Degree can be adapted to suit any company by using suitable decks, making some decks suitable for families as well.

boardgame.name: GEMJI
boardgame.description:
The legend says that in the year 2349, an adventurous young man hacked into the head of a Gemji prince - the most secretive and thriving high-class caste, unveiling a very well-kept secret. He stumbled upon a mysterious board game they used to train their children. Once the hacker reconstructed the abstract game, he revealed an ingenious system for learning various life concepts. The people who played & learned through this framework became wiser, stronger, and more capable, helping the nation become the most powerful on Earth. Nowadays, this "game" is known simply as GEMJI. The hacker changed the future once, and now it's your turn. Game on!

GEMJI is a modular game system made of 70 double-sided magnetic tiles that give you the freedom to play multiple games. Games include original titles developed by the GEMJI team, educational games, and popular classic game adaptations.

Just like a standard deck of cards, the GEMJI System offers multiple games in one set. The big difference is that GEMJI could be used in many more situations and combinations, which means MORE games! The magnetic grid, the double-face tactile interface, the unique design language, and 3D build options make GEMJI unbeatable.

Over 30 pre-made games exist currently, and more will continuously be added.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dragon Quest Walk
boardgame.description: The gameplay of Dragon Quest Walk is centered around interaction with various real-world locations in-game, with various monsters and characters from the Dragon Quest series being in the game. Players could battle monsters in order to improve their character and obtain items, or in order to advance quests.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2019 Famitsu Awards Dengeki Special Award of the Year Winner
2020 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner

boardgame.name: KeyWe
boardgame.description: Jeff and Debra, two small kiwi birds working in a whimsical post office. With no hands to help them, they must jump, flap, peck and butt-slam their way across an interactive landscape of levers, bells and buttons to get those messages delivered on time.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Family Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Radical Relocation
boardgame.description: Radical Relocation is an absurd physics-based puzzle game that turns a sleepy neighborhood into an insane obstacle course!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: XIII: Remake
boardgame.description: The remake of the original 2003 video game
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Gamescom Best Remake / Remaster of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: GRBLD
boardgame.description:
Each round in GRBLD, players draft letter cards to build words in a given category. Players draft only consonants, with vowels being free! Once the words have been built, players drop the words on their sheet. The first word will still make sense, but then things get GRBLD!

Players score by filling rows, marking off the alphabet, filling a "combo bar" by placing vowels in the correct spaces, and stacking the same consonants on each other. Via the combo bar, players unlock great powers to use, such as the "letterbomb" and the ability to use both letters on a card or even to make two words in a round.

By using various powers, players get to experience satisfying explosive turns in which they rack up both words and points. However, peak too early and risk running out of space for your words; peak too late, and risk not being able to make optimal use of your powers.

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Knock Knock!: First Words
boardgame.description:
Knock Knock! Who is it?
... It's Knock Knock! First words - a brand new game created for babies (yes babies!), toddlers and up!

There's fun behind every door in this card game with 7 different ways to play. Knock on the door and see who's there, learn new words, match cards, make sets, play memory pairs and more! Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar sets (food, toys, animals and clothes) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Knock Knock! first words is the first in a range of card games designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

7 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0+ to 3+. (6 are co-operative, 1 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free.)

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Rainbow Elf
boardgame.description:
From 2 to 6 players face each other in games of 15 to 30 minutes, indicated from the age of 6. Through simple and intuitive rules, they will interact with the village, the forest and the sky. Each goblin has its own ability, based on its color, to use for its own benefit or to annoy others.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: UkeSeme!: Sono Uke o Semeru no wa Ore da
boardgame.description:
UkeSeme! is a game themed around BL (boys' love, IE male x male romantic) manga themes and tropes. It is a quick-playing, simple game. Players hold cards with different archetypal BL character types-- Idol singer, high school student, butler, etc-- and take turns pairing them together. Players then discuss why they feel this pairing of characters works, and scenarios with them, to try to convince the judge to accept the pair. Alternatively, there is no single judge, and the group votes instead, but the rules are otherwise the same.

—user summary
